description.raw:
This is a retargeted version of pull request #249. This PR is aimed at the default branch instead of a prototyping branch. It also contains some changes based on reviewer feedback.

Two things still on the todo list:

1. Write more tests for the raw publications and subscriptions. It would be especially good to have tests that use multiple processes. Two sub-tests were added in 1cc9ddf but more are needed.

2. Determine whether we would rather have the `Publish(~)` implementation proposed [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/249/wip-subscribe-and-publish-raw-serialized/activity#comment-51885932) which is cleaner and easier to follow, or the current implementation which is more aggressive about avoiding unnecessary deserialization.

Note that some of the reviewer feedback is being addressed separately in pull request #250, and I expect that branch to get merged first.
description.html:
This is a retargeted version of pull request #249. This PR is aimed at the default branch instead of a prototyping branch. It also contains some changes based on reviewer feedback.

Two things still on the todo list:

  1. Write more tests for the raw publications and subscriptions. It would be especially good to have tests that use multiple processes. Two sub-tests were added in 1cc9ddf but more are needed.

  2. Determine whether we would rather have the Publish(~) implementation proposed here which is cleaner and easier to follow, or the current implementation which is more aggressive about avoiding unnecessary deserialization.

Note that some of the reviewer feedback is being addressed separately in pull request #250, and I expect that branch to get merged first.

title: Subscribe and publish raw (serialized) data

Two things still on the todo list:

  1. Write more tests for the raw publications and subscriptions. It would be especially good to have tests that use multiple processes. Two sub-tests were added in 1cc9ddf but more are needed.

  2. Determine whether we would rather have the Publish(~) implementation proposed here which is cleaner and easier to follow, or the current implementation which is more aggressive about avoiding unnecessary deserialization.
